title: Vat Savitri 2024: Date, Timings, Puja Vidhi And Significance Of The Vat Amavasya Vrat | Times Now
text: The Vat Savitri vrat (fast) will take place on 6th June, this year. The Vat Savitiri vrat is observed by married Hindu women. "According to legend great Savitri tricked Lord Yama, the lord of death, and compelled Him to return the life of her husband Satyawan. Hence Married women observe Vat Savitri Vrat for well-being and long life of their husband," states Drik Panchang's website. The festival is mostly celebrated in states of Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab and Haryana that follow the Purnimanta calendar. Most of the festivals of Hindus in Amanta and Purnimanta lunar calendar fall on the same day. However, what makes Vat Savitri vrat unique is that in Purnimanta calendar Vat Savitri Vrat is observed during Jyeshtha Amavasya that also coincides with Shani Jayanti, In Amanta calendar Vat Savitri Vrat, which is also called as Vat Purnima Vrat, is observed during Jyeshtha Purnima. Date And Timings Of Vat Savitri VratVata Savitri Amavasya on Thursday, June 6, 2024Amavasya Tithi Begins: 07:54 PM on Jun 05, 2024Amavasya Tithi Ends: 06:07 PM on Jun 06, 2024 Vat Amavasya Vrat Vidhi On the eve of the fast, take a bath and worship worship Goddess Savitri and Satyavan under the banyan tree. Circle the banyan tree with raw cotton thread and eat satvik food at night.On the day of fasting, wake up early in the morning, take bath, wear light yellow coloured clothes and take a pledge to fast. After this, worship Goddess Savitri and Satyavan as per the rituals. Recite the story, circle the banyan tree and break the fast in the evening after sunset.
